example.eg: The ease with which he learns languages is amazing.
example.egtrans: 他学习语言的不费劲程度令人吃惊。

example.eg: Brad's ease was apparent to all as he sat in a well-padded armchair.
example.egtrans: 因为布拉德坐在一张垫得很厚实的扶手椅里，所以所有人都看得出他坐得很舒适。

example.eg: Paul took a painkiller as he wanted a little ease from his aching back.
example.egtrans: 由于想要从持续的背部疼痛中稍微轻松一会儿，保罗吃了一颗止痛药。

example.eg: He was rich, and lived a life of ease.
example.egtrans: 他很有钱，过着富足的生活。

example.eg: He rediscovered a sense of ease once his worries were behind him.
example.egtrans: 当担心被抛之脑后，他又重拾了平静之感。

example.eg: The new construction eased the demand for houses.
example.egtrans: 新建筑缓减了对住房的需求。

example.eg: He loosened the rope to ease the tension in it.
example.egtrans: 他稍微放松了一点，让绳子不那么紧绷。

example.eg: A good massage will ease your aching muscles.
example.egtrans: 一次舒适的按摩可缓减您肌肉的酸痛。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 缓减, 减轻, 纾解

example.eg: He eased his foot off the accelerator.
example.egtrans: 他松开了踩在油门上的脚。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…从某处放开, 松开

example.eg: The soldiers stood at ease before the inspection.
example.egtrans: 检阅前，士兵们稍息站立。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 随意, 自在, 不约束

example.eg: Remember to check the ease in the knitting pattern or your sweater may end up too big.
The traffic eased once we were outside London.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 缓解, 变少, 变稀

example.eg: He eased gently through the dense crowd.
example.egtrans: 他小心翼翼地从拥挤的人群中穿过。

example.eg: A few well-placed bribes eased the way for the planning application to be approved.
example.egtrans: 几次贿赂找对了人，为规划申请的批准铺平了道路。

example.eg: Open the battery compartment and ease the battery in.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使（新人）逐渐熟悉工作等, 潜入, 悄悄进入

example.eg: The top seed eased into the semi-finals with a straight-sets victory.
To slow the car down gradually, ease off the gas pedal.
You're very tough on your son. Why don't you ease off a little?
Doris gently eased the cork out of the wine bottle.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…悄悄赶走, （使）悄然离开

example.eg: You may find if you ease up a bit on the child she will behave better.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对某人放松要求, 对某人没有过去严厉

example.eg: I am more at ease when my boss is not in the office.
example.egtrans: 老板不在办公室时，我感到更加放松。

example.eg: The troops were at ease on the parade ground.
example.egtrans: 军队在阅兵场上呈稍息状。

example.eg: The captain ordered the soldiers to stand at ease.
example.egtrans: 海军上校命令士兵们稍息。

example.eg: Chris was very friendly, and I instantly felt at ease with him.
example.egtrans: 克里斯为人友好，所以在他面前时，我马上就觉得很自在。

example.eg: He eased into the chair and put his aching feet up on a stool.
You have to ease into your work after a week away from the office.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 缓和局势, 使事情变得好办

example.eg: He tried to ease the situation by cracking jokes.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 缓和紧张关系, 缓和局势

example.eg: I am always ill at ease at events where I don't know anyone.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不自在, 坐立不安, 局促不安

example.eg: Gillian put us at ease before the test by making a joke.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…放松, 使…觉得不拘束

example.eg: I found the problem pretty difficult, but the smartest girl in the class solved it with ease.
